metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7547 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the (1) send_dg and (2) send_vcfunctions in the libresolv library in the GNU C Library (aka glibc orlibc6) before 2.23 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted DNS response thattriggers a call to the getaddrinfo function with the AF_UNSPEC or AF_INET6address family, related to performing "dual A/AAAA DNS queries" and thelibnss_dns.so.2 NSS module.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.7').
